p: Viral load (VL) testing is a key component of achieving and monitoring progress towards the “third 90” of the UNAIDS 90:90:90 targets. South Africa (SA) has made great progress in improving access to testing and has the world’s largest monitoring program. Close to 5 million viral loads were performed by public laboratories in SA in 2017 [ 1]. However, logistical and pre-analytical challenges such as transporting, registering, centrifuging and storing samples threaten the quality of the testing service.
